I'm only giving it 3 stars because I didn't feel like the food was super out of the ordinary and this will be a good back up if we don't make it to our usual go to Mexican restaurants.

Casa Ramos was a last minute change of plans. Upon walking in the place was Hot temperature wise, and uncomfortable.  The service was not great and not bad. They were quick to get our drinks and chips, but then took forever to come snd take our order. This was surprising since there wasn't too many people in the restaurant. I ordered the lunch special combo which comes with an Enchilada ,burrito, rice and beans. The burritos and Enchiladas were a solid 3 of 5 stars.  Not great but not bad. So hot restaurant , 2 stars, ok food 3 stars, and ok service. Just an ok rating in my book. One positive was the lemonade, it was really good

I was in Mesa for business and wanted some good Mexican. My hotel sent me to a different Mexican restaurant but when I got there they said they were closing. I jumped on Yelp and drove to Casa Ramos and I am glad that I did. Their chips and salsa were great. I ordered the Colorado burrito and the meat was tender and the sauce was perfect. I look forward to returning and trying other things on the menu.
The food is great and the chili Colorado is to die for. Best beans I've had out here in Arizona by far. We eat here everytime we're in the area nothing else compares.

I visited this establishment with my family on 12/5/15.  This was our first time coming here, and I could not be more pleased.  The hostess was pleasant, the wait staff was efficient, polite, and friendly.  Our head waiter Juan was engaging and assisted with any questions we had.  He was also very good with my son.  I ordered off the combination plates: pick 3.  You can pick ANY 3 items from the entire combination numbers.  I chose a chicken taco, chicken chimi, and a cheese enchilada.  The platter comes with rice and refried bean, but you can order vegetarian beans/no cholesterol beans instead.  The other adult chose 3 item combo too and decided on: chicken chimi, cheese enchilada, and chili relleno.  My son got a children's plate: beef taco with rice and beans.  The meal came out pippin' hot, looked fresh, and was a large portion.  The vegetarian beans were incredible!!  It was almost like a soup.  All of us were not able to finish our meals, and shared a fried ice cream.  The major different to their fried ice cream was instead of individual corn flakes on the ice cream, the flakes were grounded up.  The edible bowl was cinnamon delicious.  I would definitely come back here.

This place is great! A surprise spot in my neck of the woods I was unaware of. I'm a native to the east valley, so having Mexican food I can enjoy outside of my extended family's cooking is difficult. I can't give it 5 stars because the service didn't blow my socks off, but the food is outstanding. You have to ask for their hot green sauce, it will burn you. :)

I have a new favorite Mexican joint! My usual affordable neighborhood place is closed for the summer, we had guests in from the east coast who wanted Mexican , I used yelp to find this place and I literally want to eat there again and I'm still full from the gigantic portion I just ate! I was happy with the staff ( take out) and the food. We arrived early to pick up our order and I noticed that when a party walks in the staff goes immediately to get their chips while the hostess is seating them, now that's service. I have 0 complaints about the food nothing we had was iffy or eh and our guests were impressed

Service was friendly and attentive and chips and salsa when we sat down were good, but the rest of the food was not very good.  The meat in my shredded beef taco tasted like it had gone bad.  My tamale needed firmer masa and more flavor, and the red sauce covering it was so bland and tasted like the last can of Rosarita enchilada sauce I regretted cooking with.  Rice and beans both lacked flavor.  I won't be back.

This is my new favorite place to get some good Mexican food! We've been a couple times and have always left full with a good box of leftovers for lunch the next day :) I love the steak fajitas! For how good the food is I'm surprised we've never had to wait for a table! The service is hit or miss, on weekends they usually are pretty on top of things but we have gone a couple times where the service was very slow... But honestly it's still worth it! Just make sure your not in a hurry :)
We've been a few times because the food is good, but the service is normally pretty slow. More than once we've had to ask for a check or remind someone that we're ready to order.
Great Carne asada, roasted onion, roasted Jalapeño. Whole pinto beans instead of refried nice touch. I gotta come here more often.

Awesome! Clean as a pin, the decor is wonderful and the food, oh the food!  Everything was excellent but the red chile beef was out of this world!  The chips and salsa are warm and fresh but I preferred the 'Hot' salsa.  The portions are huge and the price is very reasonable, its a keeper!

Read the other YELP reviews & saw they were open on Sundays, so we headed right over to satisfy our craving for Mexican food.  Better than the reviews said!  The chips arrive warm & the salsa is great, not so spicy that all you taste is the heat.  Our server was friendly & the food was amazing.  We are already planning what to order "next time"!

Chips and salsa were good - service was good. Once our order was taken, it took a considerable amount of time for our food to come out. At first, I almost became upset - but the food was well worth the wait! Someone in my party ordered the steak fajitas and the hot plate sizzled for a good 5-7 minutes at the table. Portions were large and the food was authentic. Will gladly eat there again!

Super fast and friendly service! And GREAT food! They came by a couple times to ask if everything was good and the food was out in less than 20 minutes.  This is my new favorite Mexican restaurant for sure!

**I wish I could use a 1/2...this would be 3 1/2 STARS** I was looking for a new place to try on a Sunday night.  I read the reviews here on Yelp first, then watched the "Check Please" episode.   I was dining alone, so I asked the hostess if I could sit in the bar area for dinner.  I was told there was no bartender, but the waitress would serve me there.  I was afraid I would be forgotten if I was seated there and there was no dedicated server for the bar area, so I opted for the dining room. The dining room was about half full; I was seated in a booth and waited about 8 to 10 minutes before a young man came by to bring chips and salsa and asked if I wanted something to drink.  I asked for a margarita on the rocks and a glass of water.  He came back shortly after to confirm I said frozen margarita.  No, on the rocks, please.  The waitress came by shortly after to tell me my drink was on it's way.  A frozen margarita arrived (??) I flagged down another server to correct the problem. Ok, now for the food!  The chips were fantastic!  My favorite style; crisp, not too thick and full of flavor.  The salsa they bring is good, but I asked for a hotter salsa too.  It was a small bowl of green chili heaven.  I ordered a small serving of guacamole to go with the chips.  It was quite tasty too, chunky and well seasoned, but a little over priced. For my dinner, I ordered the Talpiquena (Carne Asada with Shrimp).  It was very good; the meat was tender and the shrimp were tender and delicious as well.  The refried beans were out of this world wonderful...I am generally not so enthusiastic about refried beans, but these warrant the praise!  The flour tortillas included with meal tasted like good homemade tortillas; though they are not house made,   The service was the only thing that was lacking in this restaurant. It was inattentive and a bit aloof.  I assumed that it was because I was a woman dining alone, as nearly all the other tables didn't seem to be lacking attention.  Toward the end of my meal, my waitress did get friendlier and did bring another tortilla when I asked for it to include with my leftovers. I will come back to try other dishes (the green chili pork is on my list to try); hopefully the service will be as good as the food next time.

Good food, above average but horrible service. The hostess couldn't memorize the specials for the day and didn't bother to ask and let us know. I enjoyed the fresh salsa and warm chips, dashed a bit of salt and munched alongside our drinks.

Casa Ramos is amazing!  The best mexican restuarant I have been to in the valley and I have been to a lot!  Their service is superb, food is great, and the value is the best!  Would highly reccomend to anyone looking for the best bang for their buck!  Also, if you are ever in the Heber area, check them out up there too!
Excellent food and service! We highly recommend. We got a #20 enchilada/taco combo plate and steak fajitas.

Juan is a humble celebrity server. Everyone seems to know him and if you ask for him he will bring forth free hot chips and homemade salsa. The food was hot and the servings generous. We thought the service was quick and attentive. This was our first time eating at Casa Ramos in Mesa. We eagerly await its reopening once construction of the light rail is completed. Dinner was a five-star experience for us.

This was my first time here. It was a Mother's Day treat for me with my 2 boys. What a treat. From the out side ur kinda , I don't know. But the inside is inviting , with a warm feeling and the food is so....... Good.  This is a gem in the rough.  I would recommend this.  Food and atmosphere great. I posted pictures also. Good mexican food. Thank you my boys!! :)

I visit Mesa AZ two or three times a year.  My sister and her family take me to Mexican restaurants all over the valley...this is my favorite.  Great service.  Wonderful chips and salsa.  We all love the entrees...faitas...tacos etc.  Good margaritas.  This is my favorite!

I'll say the usual "if there was a Zero rating, I give this place a zero rating". This place has to be top 2 of the worst Mexican restaurants I have ever eaten. Prior to coming here, I read the reviews from Yelp and Google and overall it rated fairly well. So we decided to try it. Walking in looked fine and there were two large parties sitting and a few small tables. We were taken to a booth, looked over the menu, patiently waiting for someone to take our drink. 10 minutes go without a server acknowledging us. My observation was the servers were catering to the large "non-minority" parties, filling drinks, and clearing plates. I finally had to flag down the hostess to take our drinks and politely said we were needed our order in. She took our order saying "I see your server back there but I'll take your order for him" (FYI we never met our intended waiter during the meal). We had for two - number 3 (shredded beef tacos) and a GREEN chili chicken enchilada on the side. 40 minutes go by, no food, bus server is the one who only fills drink when we have to put our empty glasses at the edge of the table (average refill time is 5-10 min). I should mention that during our wait for our order, one of the two larger tables had their food and the other table food order was in progress of cooking.   After 40 minute wait, we finally received our food. Skeptic as we were, we touched our food to see if it was warm which is was. We took bite out of tacos. It took a lot to swallow a hard, graham cracker shell with non seasoned roast beef and packaged cheese. Then we took a small bite out of enchilada. Although we ordered a GREEN one, we got a RED one. At this point we thought oh well just eat it. First and only bite from that so called authentic sauce was "I can tasted the aluminum from this canned store bought enchilada sauce". Here is where my boyfriend and I decided "no more, we aren't paying for this gross food, only the drinks." We flagged down the hostess and told her we aren't eating and just want the check for our drinks. Again we wait.  Finally I assumed the manager comes to us, asking what is wrong with the food. I told her 1 - service is slow 2 - taco shells tasted like they were baked not fried and no salt 3 - our order was wrong and enchilada sauce was clearly store bought. 4 - beans said awful and the cheese was not the mix or blended I would expect from an "authentic" Mexican restaurant.  She defended the quality of food. Her tone was non concerning and felt like she didn't care. She said she would change our bill.   Another 5-10 minutes go by until we get our new bill of $2.43 (one Pepsi with tax).   I should note that all the minority tables took longer to service than the causation tables. I felt bad for this table of 3. They had waited 50 min for their food and didn't complain nor received an apology. Also during this time, a family of 5 were seated next to the table of 3 and because all the servers focused their attention on the big tables, they ended up walking out. No one came up to them nor apologized which I informed the manager of this mistreatment.  Never again will we come here. I feel bad for the small tables. I guess the restaurant is more concerned for the 18% gratitude from large parties than providing customer service to all their customers.  The worst part was the food. People who wrote good reviews, what is wrong with you! Their food is disgusting. How can you call this quality food?  I do have to say thank to you Casa Roma. "Thank you making me appreciate Commodores Guadalajara restaurant even more. If we didn't experience the crap service you provided and disgusting canned food you served us, we would have taken for granted the excellent food and service we get EVERY visit at Commodores."  I will gladly continue to drive to Commodores (7th ave and I-17) to eat quality food and excellent customer.

Saw CR II on Check Please, Arizona yesterday and liked what I saw, so we checked it out last night. They were out of horchata and flan, apparently a run on the latter due to being showcased on the show earlier in the day. I had combo fajitas (steak + chicken), while zombie girl had a fajitas choice that included fish, shrimp, and scallops. Both were excellent. Tried the Cheese Crispy appetizer, it was just OK - a bit on the greasy side. Chips and accompanying salsa both excellent. Prices are very reasonable for the quality and quantity of food, service was great, the place is clean and clearly well-run. Will definitely be back.

We came here after seeing it featured on check please.  The food was good. I had the pork carnitas and they had good flavor. The service on the other hand wasn't the greatest. Thankfully the bus boy took our order and took care of us more than our actual server. I would go back, it was good.

Went for the first (and last time) on Friday for lunch at 2pm.  There were 4 of us. There was one other table of 4. In the entire restaurant. We waited forever for drinks, a server, our food and our bill. The food was OKAY but not worth waiting over an hour.   Won't be back.
Loved every bite. 5 stars all day long! I have been to the one in Heber, but this one is even better!   Even the beans were good, could be a meal on their own.

So my girlfriend and I were on our way to have some Indian food when I found this Mexican Restaurant with a five star rating on Yelp. We thought we had to give it a try and I am really glad we did.  I was at first worried about the location but when you walk in it was nothing like I expected. What a great decor this place had. It was open, colorful, and comfortable. The service was great  and the staff was friendly.  I am not a Mexican food specialist and can't tell you what authentic is but I can tell you what taste good and  this place had it all from warm chips and a fresh pint of salsa, rice and beans to kill for, a flavorful red sauce, and just delicious food.   We will for sure be regulars here and have already passed the word to friends who have enjoyed this restaurant as much as us.
Very good food, family owned, friendly staff. One of our favorite restaurants in the east  valley.

The outside of the restraunt was nasty. Once you got inside, the decor was good and the music was great. Fresh warm chips and salsa, wasn't hot but good. I had pork carnitas. They were pretty good, shredded pork with a green salsa some warm tortillas(not homemade) rice(fluffy) and refried beans (nice flavor). Service was great! There is also a full bar. First time there I will be back to try something else.
Love this place! Authentic Mexican food with flavor.   We try new plates when we go her and we have loved everything so far.

Recently visited this place again. Sadly, the quality of the food is not the same as it was over the summer. The chips and salsa are still good, when we went anyway. The sauce and some of the meat are not as good as I remember, so are the refried beans.
